title: Tenuta di Fessina 2017 Erse Rosato (Etna)
description: Grilled herb, Mediterranean scrub, brimstone and wild berry aromas march to the forefront. Fresh and savory, the medium-bodied palate offers wild raspberry, crushed strawberry, white pepper and dried aromatic herb set against tangy acidity.

title: The Eyrie Vineyards 2016 Pinot Meunier (Dundee Hills)
description: Most often found in sparkling wines, here the grape is given a chance to show its stuff as a full-blown still red. It's tart and chewy, with chunky fruit flavors of cranberry and cherry. More tannic and darker than its cousin Pinot Noir, this finishes with citrusy acidity.

title: Trisaetum 2016 Coast Range Estate Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: From a cool site set on sedimentary and volcanic soils, this sets a sleek, supple tone throughout the palate. It deftly mixes in strata of earth and herb under black cherry fruit. Tannins are polished and firm. It's drinking well already, but seems likely to improve further with additional bottle aging.

title: Via Romano 2015 Barbera (El Dorado County)
description: This is a really well-made, flavorful and nicely balanced wine from a new winery that's doing exciting things. It's full bodied, moderately tannic and moderately acidic which is typical of the varietal, but backed by wonderful ripe black-cherry, black-olive and black-pepper flavors.

title: Wolff 2017 Rosé (Central Coast)
description: A pale shade of pink in the glass, this Grenache-based rosé is excellent, starting with soft aromas of bubblegum and pink lemonade. The palate is zesty, fresh and framed by persistent acid, with tangy raspberry, plum-skin and tight pomegranate flavors captured in a taut texture.

title: Pfeffingen 2016 Dry Scheurebe (Pfalz)
description: While mineral driven on first whiff, aeration reveals increasingly fragrant aromas of white blossom, pineapple and grapefruit in this wine. It's dry and intensely zesty on the palate, marked by a tropical lychee note and a refreshing herbal undertone. A light-bodied, invigorating sip to enjoy now–2023.

title: Calcaneus 2017 Romice delle Sciare Nerello Mascalese (Etna)
description: Don't let the light salmon color fool you: This savory rosato is chock-full of flavor and brightness, opening with aromas of grilled herb, wildflower, red berry and a whiff of sea breeze. On the tangy palate, juicy acidity accompanies ripe cherry, tangerine zest, strawberry and graphite along with a hint of bread dough. White pepper and a salty note linger on the finish.

title: Ampelos 2015 Ampelos Vineyard Syrache Syrah-Grenache (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: This blends 70% Syrah and 30% Grenache from the estate site. The wine is bright and fresh on the nose, a whiff of peppery meat and earthy leather arriving first. The midplate takes on more ripe concentration in brambly blackberry and strawberry.

title: Beacon Hill 2016 La Sierra Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: This supple, sexy wine is ready, set, go for immediate enjoyment. Pretty cherry and chocolate flavors round out the middle, with sweet spices all the way through a most pleasurable finish. All Pommard clone, it was aged 18 months in 30% new French oak.

title: Belden Barns 2016 Serendipity Block Pinot Noir (Sonoma Mountain)
description: From what the producer considers its best pocket of vineyard, planted to multiple clones, this is a beautifully expressive wine, well-integrated and delicately layered, with a flowing, silky texture. The flavors delve into raspberry, strawberry and black tea, humming along to an earthy finish.

title: Ben Haines 2016 B Minor Pinot Noir (Yarra Valley)
description: This is a light-bodied, delicate Pinot Noir, with bright aromas of crunchy cherry fruit, black pepper and game. These tones carry to the palate are are woven together by dusty tannins and poised acidity.

title: Bergström 2016 Gregory Ranch Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: Think cherry pie fruit with a touch of pastry crust and you've got a handle on this tasty wine. The acids add citrus highlights, principally pineapple, and the tannins have a hint of green tea astringency.

title: Bernardus 2016 Garys' Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Ripe but sour cherry aromas meet with purple flowers, hibiscus, subtle chaparral and a hint of juniper on the nose of this bottling. It's energetic on the palate, with earthy clay flavors playing against the background of rhubarb, red plums and orange rinds.

title: Bischöfliche Weingüter Trier 2017 Kanzemer Altenberg Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)
description: Subtle, savory hints of saffron and crushed mineral on the nose belie the bolder tones of pink grapefruit and lime that await on the palate of this semidry Riesling. It's fresh and fruity yet has elegance and restraint. The finish is moderately long and earthy.

title: Bodegas Bilbainas 2013 Viña Pomal Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Cinnamon, clove and oak-spice aromas frame notes of berries and citrus peels on the nose. A full palate feels a touch oily and creamy, while this tastes of savory, lightly salted plum and berry fruits. The saltiness carries over to a well-formed finish. Drink through 2025.

title: Bodegas Faustino 2006 Faustino I Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Smooth, welcoming aromas of cola, black fruits and integrated oak are soft and indicate that this is ready to drink. A plump, sappy palate delivers ripe berry and chocolate flavors, while this is fleshy on a finish weighted down by berry pulp. Drink through 2021.

title: Bodegas Valdemar 2011 Conde Valdemar Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Baked blackberry and cassis aromas are ripe to the max and come with plenty of oak-driven vanilla. On the palate, this is plump but honest, with depth and give. Baked berry flavors are enriched by oaky vanilla and coffee notes, while this is smooth and steady on the finish. Drink through 2024.

title: Bouchaine 2016 Hyde Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: With a touch of spice from well-integrated oak, this is a fresh and fruity white from a remarkable vineyard site, one of the best in the appellation. It shows balance within a context of undeniable ripeness and grip, the flavor defined in baked apple, almond and cinnamon.

title: Buehler 2015 Zinfandel (Napa Valley)
description: This is a great value for a wine of such quality, made with a handful of Petite Sirah that grows in the same field-blended site. Layered and grippy, it shows structured blackberry and mocha flavors around secondary tones of leather and earth.

title: Covila 2013 II Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Cool earth and horsey aromas are part of a nose that also contains quality berry and plum notes. A healthy palate with form and finesse generates flavors of smoky berry and chocolaty oak. Oak spice and residual acidic energy push this to its finale. Drink through 2023.
